definition: pit/threshold/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing water/☵
karez, qanat or "horizontal well" (irrigation and water management system used in Xinjiang, Central Asia and Middle East)
erhua variant of 土坎[tu3 kan3]
erhua variant of 門坎|门坎[men2 kan3]

sentences.english: Xinjiang Karez back in the Han Dynasty two thousand years ago, there were problems of its shape.
sentences.chinese: 新疆的坎兒井早在兩千年前的漢代即出現其雛形。

sentences.english: If the motorcycle goes over a bump , the engine misfires.
sentences.chinese: 摩托車只要一經過坎兒，發動機就會熄火。

sentences.english: He was very bad to me at the end, and i can't live over it.
sentences.chinese: 最後他對我的態度很惡劣，我一直沒能跨過這個坎兒。

sentences.english: Aging forty years old like living on a threshold.
sentences.chinese: 四十歲好像是人的一個坎兒。

sentences.english: What I really enjoyed was the Karez Well centre devoted to karez¸
sentences.chinese: 我真正享受的是坎兒井中心。
